review_blob: Amazing beer. Although it has 8.4 abv, the alcohol content is very balanced with the taste, which turns this beer into a very nice choice. The Aroma is very present and strong, with floral hints and definitely citrus. The appearence is exsquisite and the palate is very soft and light. Not very carbonated, just enough. Overall this beer is always a choice, especially during the sunnier days, and unfortunately the experience of drinking it cannot easiliy be put in words.

A beer that considers itself as an "Abbey" one, but does not show its work.
It feels as if very little effort was put into making this beer different and better than the other Super Bocks. Disappointing.
The Aroma was not felt at all, the taste is to watery, and overall it resembles a mass-production lager, which it appears the most.

Very strong malty aroma with hints of coffee. The appearence is also very classy, with a brown hazy colour. The taste is medium bitter. The palate is creamy, staying a while in your mouth before it goes away, very nice. Overall it is mainly a winter Bock, that stands out in terms of flavour and palate. Very secure choice, at all times.

Malty aroma, yet weak. Nice appearence, no different from other Pilsener. A nice and flavourous taste makes FelsGold extremely drinkable and a good option for a cheap lager. The body is watery and the carbonation is quite sadly average. Overall this beer has a good price/quality balance and proves to be a good choice in the range of cheap beers.
